io.multimap

Class Map.Stats

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.multimap.Map.Stats
  • Enclosing class:
    Map

    public static class Map.Stats
extends Object
    This type is a pure data holder for reporting statistical information.
    Since:
    0.4.0
    Author:
    Martin Trenkmann

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getBlockSize()
      Returns the block size of the map or partition.
      long getKeySizeAvg()
      Returns the average size in number of bytes of all keys in a map or partition.
      long getKeySizeMax()
      Returns the size in number of bytes of the largest key in a map or partition.
      long getKeySizeMin()
      Returns the size in number of bytes of the smallest key in a map or partition.
      long getListSizeAvg()
      Returns the average number of values associated with a key in a map or partition.
      long getListSizeMax()
      Returns the largest number of values associated with a key in a map or partition.
      long getListSizeMin()
      Returns the smallest number of values associated with a key in a map or partition.
      long getNumBlocks()
      Returns the number of blocks currently written to disk.
      long getNumKeysTotal()
      Returns the total number of keys in a map or partition, including keys that are currently not associated with any value.
      long getNumKeysValid()
      Returns the number of valid keys in a map or partition.
      long getNumPartitions()
      Returns the number of partitions in a map.
      long getNumValuesTotal()
      Returns the total number of values in a map or partition, including values that are marked as removed.
      long getNumValuesValid()
      Returns the number of values in a map or partition that are not marked as removed.

      String toString()

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getBlockSize

        public long getBlockSize()
        Returns the block size of the map or partition.

      • getKeySizeAvg

        public long getKeySizeAvg()
        Returns the average size in number of bytes of all keys in a map or partition. Note that keys that are currently not associated with any value are not taken into account.

      • getKeySizeMax

        public long getKeySizeMax()
        Returns the size in number of bytes of the largest key in a map or partition.

      • getKeySizeMin

        public long getKeySizeMin()
        Returns the size in number of bytes of the smallest key in a map or partition.

      • getListSizeAvg

        public long getListSizeAvg()
        Returns the average number of values associated with a key in a map or partition. Note that keys that are currently not associated with any value are not taken into account.

      • getListSizeMax

        public long getListSizeMax()
        Returns the largest number of values associated with a key in a map or partition.

      • getListSizeMin

        public long getListSizeMin()
        Returns the smallest number of values associated with a key in a map or partition. Note that keys that are currently not associated with any value are not taken into account.

      • getNumBlocks

        public long getNumBlocks()
        Returns the number of blocks currently written to disk. Note that in-memory write buffer blocks that are associated with each keys are not taken into account. For more details please refer to the overview section of the project's website.

      • getNumKeysTotal

        public long getNumKeysTotal()
        Returns the total number of keys in a map or partition, including keys that are currently not associated with any value.

      • getNumKeysValid

        public long getNumKeysValid()
        Returns the number of valid keys in a map or partition. A valid key is associated with at least one value.

      • getNumValuesTotal

        public long getNumValuesTotal()
        Returns the total number of values in a map or partition, including values that are marked as removed. Note that this number can only be decreased by running an optimize operation.

      • getNumValuesValid

        public long getNumValuesValid()
        Returns the number of values in a map or partition that are not marked as removed.

      • getNumPartitions

        public long getNumPartitions()
        Returns the number of partitions in a map. The value could be different from that specified in options when creating a map due to the fact that the next prime number has been chosen. For partition-specific statistics the value is set to 0.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • parseFromBuffer

        protected void parseFromBuffer(ByteBuffer buffer)
